TestCase.Title: Test case EID_CLIENT_D_05
TestCase.Purpose: This test evaluates that the texts to denote the access rights displayed by the eID-Client conform not to [TR-03119].

Command.Text: Follow the Online-Authentication as described in until the access rights are displayed. Use the eService certificate [CERT_CV_TERM_1_B] instead of [CERT_CV_TERM_1_A].

TestStep.Description: In deviation to EID_CLIENT_B_01 also use the element "AuthenticatedAuxiliaryData" in DIDAuthenticateEAC1InputType.
The element "AuthenticatedAuxiliaryData" contains a valid date for the age verification.
The element "AuthenticatedAuxiliaryData" contains a valid date for the document validity check.
The element "AuthenticatedAuxiliaryData" contains a valid municipality ID.
Note that the certificate [CERT_CV_TERM_1_B] in combination with the AuthenticatedAuxiliaryData grants access to any data group and special function displayable in the user interface.

ExpectedResult.Text: For each access right displayed to the user, the corresponding text from [TR-03119], Section A.5.1. is used to denote the access right. In particular, access rights for which no text is available in [TR-03119] are not displayed by the eID-Client.
